intro: Astragalus demetrii, commonly known as the Demetrius milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, hairy pods that contain several seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems. Astragalus demetrii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
